transportAdvice: Bergen's compact city centre is very walkable, with most major attractions reachable on foot. Public transit consists of buses and a light rail line connecting the centre to outer neighbourhoods and the airport, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold, wet, and dark with frequent rain and occasional snow; the shortest days of the year make sightseeing time limited.
Still cold and rainy with limited daylight, though days begin to lengthen noticeably toward month's end.
Early spring brings slightly milder temperatures but persistent rain; snow is possible at higher elevations.
Temperatures become more pleasant and daylight increases significantly, though showers remain frequent.
One of the more agreeable months with longer days, blooming landscapes, and a good mix of sun and cloud.
Warm and bright with very long days approaching the summer solstice; rain is still possible but conditions are generally pleasant.
The warmest month of the year with long daylight hours; expect a mix of sunny spells and rain showers typical of Bergen's climate.
Warm summer conditions continue with lush green scenery; rain remains a regular occurrence so a waterproof layer is advisable.
Autumn arrives with cooling temperatures and increasing rainfall; foliage begins to turn, offering scenic colour in the surrounding hills.
Noticeably cooler and wetter with shorter days; Bergen's reputation as one of Europe's rainiest cities is well earned this month.
Cold, grey, and frequently rainy with limited daylight; the city takes on a quieter, more local character as tourist numbers drop.
Dark and wet with very short days; festive Christmas markets and lights brighten the city centre during the holiday season.
